Ice::

She continued to walk outside and away from the base.  She left a 
small trail of blood as she made her way. But the softly falling snow 
would cover it in a matter of minutes.  She just kept going. She 
headed now in a northern direction. She sniffed the wind and caught 
scent of something.  She couldn't tell what it was. She shrugged her 
shoulders and kept walking. 

She came to stop about an hour later.  She was starting to feel very 
tired and her shoulder was throbbing. She layed down in the snow. And 
was almosts invisible, except for the red blood on the shoulder.  She 
put her head on her front paws and started to drift in and out of 
sleep.  The snow was lightly falling and started to cover her with a 
thin veil of snow. 

She slipped into sleep and dreamed of the old times with Lunerpine.
She dreamed of sparring with him again. She dreamed of fighting with 
him. She dreamed of how she managed to get him to lower his gueard 
when sparring and then getting him.  She had a very large grin on her 
polar bear face as she lay in the snow, sleeping.
